Pre-Game Insights: Croatia will be aiming to bounce back to winning ways after suffering a narrow loss against Portugal
Poland secured a thrilling 3-2 victory over Scotland to begin the competition on a positive note
Injury & Team News: Croatia will be without the services of Lovro Majer, Josip Stanisic and Martin Erlic through injuries. Duje Caleta-Car will be aiming to start here after putting in an impressive performance off the bench against Portugal. Zlatko Dalic will likely make some changes after a strong second-half showing from his team in the last game.
Meanwhile, Poland have all the players available in their squad except for Arkadiusz Milik and Jakub Kiwior who are ruled out due to injury. Kiwior was subbed off in the last match.
Predicted Lineup: Croatia predicted lineup (4-3-3): Livakovic (GK); Caleta-Car, Sutalo, Gvardiol, Sosa; Modric, Susic, Kovacic; Pasalic, Kramaric, Matanovic
Poland predicted lineup (3-5-2): Bulka (GK); Bednarek, Dawidowicz, Walukiewicz; Frankowski, Szymanski, Zielinski, Urbanski, Zalewski; Piatek, Lewandowski
Match Prediction: Croatia will be aiming to bounce back in this match after enduring a difficult away match against Portugal. With the home support on their side, we expect them to get this over the line. However, given the quality Poland possesses in their squad, a draw looks like a fair result for both teams.
